post_text:
During the regular meeting of the Board of Education held on July 20, 2020 the Board unanimously approved the Resolution Affirming the Transition to School Plan. At this time Rochester CUSD #3a is planning to begin the 2020-2021 school year in our blended remote model at 50% student capacity. This information is being communicated to you today so that we all have the greatest opportunity possible to plan. Please understand that this recommendation can change as conditions evolve.

To learn more about the details of blended remote learning at 50% student capacity and the rest of our District's return to learning plans please see the executive summary located on the COVID-19 Resources page of our website. https://docs.google.com/document/d/12C2rPNKX77veGe7G39HglljWWBdu6FsWWmoovkbwMfU/edit?usp=sharing #TraditionofExcellence🚀

Do you need information about the Free or Reduced Lunch program?

It’s easy to apply! Just email lunch@rochester3a.net for more information or an application. Current families may also complete the application online during the Online Registration process. Please call our District Office at 217-498-6210 ext 1509 or email lunch@rochester3a.net for assistance.

post_text:
Are you a new resident of the Rochester CUSD 3A District?
Do you have a kindergartner?
Do you need to enroll your students?
Good news- You can get your students enrolled NOW!

If you and your students are new to Rochester, please contact our district office for assistance and instructions. You may call 217-498-6210 ext 1509 or email (Katie Bulava) kbulava@rochester3a.net. All paperwork can be submitted via email or by making an appointment to come by our office.

**Please note: only new students to the district will need to enroll.
If your students attended Rochester last school year, there is no need to re-enroll. Returning students will need to complete Online Registration.**

post_text:
Rochester CUSD 3A is grateful for all of our amazing retiring staff members! Your service and dedication to our staff and students is appreciated. You will be missed!

We are also pleased to announce this year's winners of the Those Who Excel Teacher of the Year and Support Personnel/ Team of the Year, as well as the Impact Award, given to a staff member in their first or second year with Rochester CUSD 3A. Congratulations to our 2019-20 award winners!

Those Who Excel Teacher of the Year- Maggie Murray
Those Who Excel Support Personnel/ Team of the Year- Debbie Burke and Jennifer Crouch
Impact Award- Caleb Jett

post_text:
Dear Parents,

Rochester Schools are seeing an increased number of absences due to confirmed cases of influenza A and influenza B.

We are asking that parents keep their children home if they are sick, have a temperature above 100.0, complains of headache, body aches, chills, nausea, sore throat, and/or runny nose. If your child has a fever above 100 today, please don't send them to school tomorrow. If you have to give your child Tylenol, Ibuprofen, Dayquil, etc. to get through the day, please don't send them to school. If they experience vomiting and/or diarrhea please don't send them to school tomorrow.

We are working with our teachers, students, and custodial staff to keep our buildings clean and our students healthy. We appreciate your cooperation.
text:
Dear Parents,

Rochester Schools are seeing an increased number of absences due to confirmed cases of influenza A and influenza B.

We are asking that parents keep their children home if they are sick, have a temperature above 100.0, complains of headache, body aches, chills, nausea, sore throat, and/or runny nose. If your child has a fever above 100 today, please don't send them to school tomorrow. If you have to give your child Tylenol, Ibuprofen, Dayquil, etc. to get through the day, please don't send them to school. If they experience vomiting and/or diarrhea please don't send them to school tomorrow.

We are working with our teachers, students, and custodial staff to keep our buildings clean and our students healthy. We appreciate your cooperation.

post_text:
Good morning,

Due to the incoming inclement weather, Rochester CUSD 3A will be dismissing all schools early today. The Intermediate, Junior High and High School campuses will be dismissing at 1:50 pm today. The Elementary EC-1 and 2-3 campuses will be dismissing at 2:00 pm today. All evening practices and events will be cancelled, including 7th through 12th grade Parent Teacher Conferences and Kindergarten Registration. Any exceptions will be communicated directly to the teams affected. Parent Teacher Conferences for grades 7th through 12th will be rescheduled to Wednesday, February 19th.

Thank you,

Mr. Clover

Interim Superintendent

post_text:
Good evening,

Earlier this evening, we were made aware of a threat on social media. Administration has worked with law enforcement in investigating this information fully. We have addressed the situation with those involved. At this time, we do not believe an imminent threat exists. School will follow normal daily routines tomorrow, Wednesday, January 23, 2019. Our utmost priority remains the safety and security of our students and staff and we will continue to monitor all social media and student interactions closely. Thank you for your continued support of the Rochester School District.

Sincerely,

Dr. Lance Thurman

Superintendent

post_text:
Good afternoon,

This is just a reminder that all schools dismiss early on Friday, December 21st for winter break. Buses will depart from the Route 29 Campus at approximately 1:50 p.m. and at approximately 2:05 from the elementary campus.

Please note that the RHS Semester Exam schedule also includes early dismissals on Wednesday and Thursday; however, buses will run at the normal dismissal times on those days. Most RHS students will also finish final exams before noon on Friday.

Classes resume on Monday, January 7, 2019. Best wishes for a safe and relaxing winter break!

Dr. Lance Thurman
Superintendent

post_text:
November 13, 2018

Dear Parents and Staff:

The Route 29 Campus, which houses Rochester Junior and Senior High Schools, was placed on lock down this morning at approximately 8:45 a.m. The lock down was declared after an Illinois State Police K-9 Unit arrived on campus to conduct a routine search of the premises. As a precautionary measure for this type of search, the buildings are placed on lock down in order to insulate all students and staff as the dog teams assess our facilities. The lock down lasted approximately 70 minutes.

There was no accompanying threat to this lock down situation. This effort involved collaboration among the Rochester Police Department and the Illinois State Police. Our School Resource Officer assisted district staff and the State Police as part of the search.

Our students and staff did a great job working through the search this morning. We are grateful for their cooperation and partnership as we work to ensure the safety and security of our students and staff.

Sincerely,

Dr. Lance Thurman
Superintendent of Schools

post_text: The Rt 290 Campus Lock Down has been lifted. The K-9 unit reported an all clear sweep. Students returned to normal activities prior to 10:00 am.
text: The Rt 290 Campus Lock Down has been lifted. The K-9 unit reported an all clear sweep. Students returned to normal activities prior to 10:00 am.

post_text: Rt 29 Campus on lock down. State Police K-9 Unit is on campus conducting a routine search. No threat. Everyone is safe. Update to follow.

post_text:
Good afternoon,

Our office has been notified by several in the Rochester CUSD community about an error related to adding funds to student lunch accounts. We have notified our payment vendor, RevTrak, and are working to correct the issue. All buildings and cafeterias have been notified, and all students will be able to eat lunch today if needed. We anticipate the errors will be corrected no later than Monday, November 5th, and will notify all parents if this is not the case. Thank you for your patience as we work through this technical issue.

Thank you,

Dr. Lance Thurman

post_text:
Today a student found a shotgun shell at the entrance to the RHS track. The student gave the shell to the teacher. The teacher reported the matter to the principal.

The steel shot the student discovered is one commonly used by hunters during waterfowl season.

School officials contacted local law enforcement and conducted a visual sweep of vehicles in the parking lot. No weapons or ammunition were found.
text:
Today a student found a shotgun shell at the entrance to the RHS track. The student gave the shell to the teacher. The teacher reported the matter to the principal.

School officials contacted local law enforcement and conducted a visual sweep of vehicles in the parking lot. No weapons or ammunition were found.

post_text: Late this morning, RIS students were evacuated from the building for about 45 minutes after the fire alarm was activated by a smoke detector. Fire officials determined that the alarm was triggered by a mechanical issue. There was no smoke or fire in the building. Students enjoyed an extended recess on a beautiful fall day.
text: Late this morning, RIS students were evacuated from the building for about 45 minutes after the fire alarm was activated by a smoke detector.
